purpose: To automatically classify rose plant species using leaf images to aid botanists and eliminate manual identification

data.collection_method: Images captured using a 23MP camera in a controlled environment
data.description: Images of rose leaves from several classes such as orange, red, pink, and white roses

implementation_details.optimization: Optimization of Random Forest through tuning parameters like the number of trees and depth, and comparing information gain, gini index, and gain ratio as criteria

results.performance: Optimized Random Forest model achieved the best results compared to other classifiers

user_interface: Not specifically mentioned but suggested to be a mobile-based application using phone cameras
deployment_status: Research phase with practical implementation suggested
benefits: Decrease manual effort, increase efficiency and accuracy in plant species classification
limitations: Performance dependent on dataset size and quality; Deep learning models performed suboptimally due to small dataset size

mentions: Previous work based on k-NN algorithm for rose classification
Application of CNN and RestNet for plant classification
